normalised: ## Finding My Balance: A Dive into Ayurveda Treatments

unnormalised: Life in Mumbai can be a whirlwind. Between the 09:00 hrs train commutes and the constant deadlines at work, I felt increasingly drained. My skin was dull, my energy levels were low, and I was battling persistent headaches. That's when my wise Nani, always a fountain of traditional wisdom, suggested I explore Ayurveda.

My skin was dull, my energy levels were low, and I was battling persistent headaches. That is when my wise Nani, always a fountain of traditional wisdom, suggested I explore Ayurveda.

unnormalised: Frankly, I was a bit skeptical. I’d always associated Ayurveda with old wives' tales. But desperation, as they say, is a great motivator. So, I booked a consultation at a reputed Ayurvedic clinic in Kerala – the land of Ayurveda itself! I chose a place near Kovalam beach, envisioning a serene escape.

unnormalised: My first consultation on 12/02/2023 was with Dr. Sharma, a warm and insightful practitioner. He spent over an hour understanding my lifestyle, diet, and stress levels. He diagnosed a Vata imbalance (something about too much air and space in my body!). He prescribed a personalized treatment plan that included Abhyanga (oil massage), Shirodhara (oil pouring on the forehead – surprisingly relaxing!), and a specific Ayurvedic diet.

unnormalised: The initial three days were intense. The Panchakarma treatments felt like a deep cleanse, physically and mentally. The food, though different from my usual chaat and vada pav diet, was surprisingly delicious and nourishing. I even started enjoying waking up at 06:00 hrs for yoga sessions by the beach.

unnormalised: After two weeks, I noticed a significant difference. My headaches disappeared, my skin glowed, and I felt a renewed sense of energy. More importantly, I felt grounded. The Ayurvedic principles of mindful eating, regular exercise, and stress management became integrated into my daily routine. I even learned to make my own triphala churna (a digestive aid) from Nani’s recipe!

unnormalised: It’s been six months since my Ayurvedic retreat, and I still incorporate many of the practices into my life. Of course, Mumbai life still throws curveballs, but I now have tools to manage my stress and maintain my balance. My next check-up with Dr. Sharma is scheduled for 26/01/2024, and I'm looking forward to continuing my journey towards holistic wellness. It turns out Nani was right all along!
